com.bluegosling.concurrent.executors

Interface SerializingExecutor<K>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of key, used to group tasks into serial pipelines
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ActorThreadPool, PipeliningExecutor

    public interface SerializingExecutor<K>
    An executor that serializes multiple tasks that correspond to the same key. So tasks submitted for the same key will be executed in FIFO order. If tasks are submitted for different keys, they may be executed concurrently.

    This is useful for establishing serial pipelines, where concurrency is achieved through the use of multiple pipelines. One specific use is for sending events to a listener. So that one slow listener doesn't block others, each can be its own pipeline. All notifications for a listener are then delivered in FIFO order, but a single slow listener doesn't have to stall deliver of notifications to other listeners.

    See Also:
    Executor, FluentExecutorService

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(K k, Runnable task)
      Executes the given task, associated with the given key.
      default Executor newExecutorFor(K k)
      Returns an executor that associates all tasks with the given key.
      default <T> FluentFuture<T> submit(K k, Callable<T> task)
      Executes the given task, associated with the given key, and returns a future that will complete when the task completes or is cancelled.

      Executes the given task, associated with the given key, and returns a future that will complete when the task completes or is cancelled.
      default <T> FluentFuture<T> submit(K k, Runnable task, T value)
      Executes the given task, associated with the given key, and returns a future that will complete when the task completes or is cancelled.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(K k,
             Runnable task)
        Executes the given task, associated with the given key. The task will run after any previously submitted tasks for the same key and before any subsequently submitted tasks for the same key.
        Parameters:
        k - the key
        task - the task
        See Also:
        Executor.execute(Runnable)

      • newExecutorFor

        default Executor newExecutorFor(K k)
        Returns an executor that associates all tasks with the given key. This is useful to adapt this class to the standard Executor interface.
        Parameters:
        k - the key
        Returns:
        an executor that associates all tasks with the given key

      • submit

        default FluentFuture<Void> submit(K k,
                                  Runnable task)
        Executes the given task, associated with the given key, and returns a future that will complete when the task completes or is cancelled.
        Parameters:
        k - the key
        task - the task
        Returns:
        a future that will complete when the task completes or is cancelled
        See Also:
        execute(Object, Runnable)

      • submit

        default <T> FluentFuture<T> submit(K k,
                                   Runnable task,
                                   T value)
        Executes the given task, associated with the given key, and returns a future that will complete when the task completes or is cancelled. On successful completion, the future's value will be that of the given value.
        Parameters:
        k - the key
        task - the task
        value - the value of the future on successful completion
        Returns:
        a future that will complete when the task completes or is cancelled
        See Also:
        execute(Object, Runnable)

      • submit

        default <T> FluentFuture<T> submit(K k,
                                   Callable<T> task)
        Executes the given task, associated with the given key, and returns a future that will complete when the task completes or is cancelled. On successful completion, the future's value will be the value returned by the given task
        Parameters:
        k - the key
        task - the task, which produces the value of the future on success
        Returns:
        a future that will complete when the task completes or is cancelled
        See Also:
        execute(Object, Runnable)
